text: Benzene, C6H6, reacts with oxygen, O2, to form CO2 and H2O. How much O2 is required for the complete combustion of 1.0 mol C6H6?

A 25.0 mL sample of 0.15 M silver nitrate, AgNO3, is reacted with a 3.58 g sample of calcium chloride, CaCl2 (M = 111.0). Which of the following statements is true?

options.A: Silver nitrate is the limiting reactant and calcium nitrate precipitates.
options.B: Silver nitrate is the limiting reactant and silver chloride precipitates.
options.C: Calcium chloride is the limiting reactant and calcium nitrate precipitates.
options.D: Calcium chloride is the limiting reactant and silver chloride precipitates.

text: Which aqueous solution exhibits the largest freezing point depression?

A 2.0 mL sample of a colorless solution, when treated with a few drops of 2 M hydrochloric acid, forms a white precipitate which dissolves when the solution is heated to boiling. The original solution could have contained which of the following cations? I. 0.1 M Ag+ II. 0.1 M Pb2+
Which compound has the lowest normal boiling point?

A student is separating CHCl3 (bp = 61 °C) from CHCl2CHCl2 (bp = 146 °C) by distillation. She has just begun to collect the first distillate in the receiving flask. At what position in the apparatus will the temperature be 61 °C?
How is the enthalpy of vaporization of a substance related to its enthalpy of fusion?

options.A: The enthalpy of vaporization is greater than the enthalpy of fusion.
options.B: The enthalpy of vaporization is equal to the enthalpy of fusion.
options.C: The enthalpy of vaporization is less than the enthalpy of fusion.
options.D: There is no general relationship between a substance's enthalpy of vaporization and enthalpy of fusion.

An electrolysis cell is operated for 3000 s using a current of 1.50 A. From which 1.0 M solution will the greatest mass of metal be deposited?

The reduction of O2 to H2O in acidic solution has a standard reduction potential of +1.23 V. What is the effect on the half-cell potential at 25 °C when the pH of the solution is increased by one unit? O2(g) + 4 H+(aq) + 4 e–  2 H2O(l)

options.A: The half-cell potential decreases by 59 mV.
options.B: The half-cell potential increases by 59 mV.
options.C: The half-cell potential decreases by 236 mV.
options.D: The half-cell potential increases by 236 mV.

text: Given the two standard reduction potentials below, what is the Ksp of Ag2CrO4 at 25 °C? Ag2CrO4(s) + 2 e–  2 Ag(s) + CrO42–(aq) Eº = +0.446 V Ag+(aq) + e–  Ag(s) Eº = +0.799 V

options.A: five sulfur-oxygen bonds and no oxygen-oxygen bonds.
options.B: four sulfur-oxygen bonds and one oxygen-oxygen bond.
options.C: three sulfur-oxygen bonds and two oxygen-oxygen bonds.
options.D: one sulfur-oxygen bond and four oxygen-oxygen bonds.

text: Which statement about bonding is correct?

options.A: A  bond has cylindrical symmetry about the bonding axis.
options.B: A π bond is twice as strong as a  bond.
options.C: A double bond consists of two π bonds.
options.D: A π bond results from the sideways overlap of hybridized orbitals.
